# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can solve this problem using Julia's DataFrames package. This function will add a new column `ym` to the existing dataframe `df`. 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x) -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

How to use this function:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=Date[now()+Month(i) for i in 1:30]) # creating sample data
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to your dataframe. The value of each cell will be the year and month combined into one number (e.g., 202204 for April 2022).
